item.title: Lots of grit on the cyclelane between Starverton Junction and Cheltenham, 23rd June
item.description:
Hi, I have raised this with several council departments who have come back to say that this is the best forum to discuss such matter. Issue first raised on 1st June 2024, and has worsened since then. Appreciate anything you can do to clean up the cycleway soon as it will be used more and more in the summer months. ----------------------- Evening, Just to say that there is a lot of debris/grit on the cycle lane into Staverton Bridge (please see annotated picture below).This isn’t safe for cyclists as the current surface conditions will significantly increase chances of punctures or skidding. Please can you look into this. Appreciate the effort gone into building the cycleway but it if isn’t properly maintained then cyclists will be forced to use the road in places. This is near a significant building site so that may be contributing to the build up of material on the cycle lane. Regards, Chris

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Vegetation on verge is so overgrown it is getting dangerous to cross the road at the roundabout, 23rd June
item.description:
Walking from Stansby towards Leyson Road, trying to cross at the roundabout is becoming increasingly dangerous due to extremely long uncut grass (particularly for anyone with limited mobility) at the crossing point

item.title: Dead tree dropping material onto pavement & road, 23rd June
item.description:
Large dead tree in garden is starting to drop large amounts of material onto pavement and road. Needs dealing with before large branches start dropping, possibly damaging parked vehicles or injuring pedestrians. Glencairn Park Road (A40 Lansdown Road end), close to post box. Tree is in garden adjacent to Co-op Funeralcare (72 Lansdown Road).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glencairn Park Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nettles and PROW inaccessible., 22nd June
item.description:
We walked from Hatherley and Redding Cricket ground following the right of way to get to Leckhampton Lane. The map showed a bridge over Ham Brook. It was hard going with long grass and nettles. when we got to the tree line just before Ham Brook there were overgrown trees and 5ft high nettles. We couldn’t see where the ROW went. We had to turn back all the way to the cricket ground and walk along Shurdington Road. The map showed a bridge but we couldn’t get anywhere near it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Alarm sounding from green cabinet, 22nd June
item.description:
An alarting is sounding from green cabinet just after the subway under the A40 on the Elmbridge Court Roundabout. The only markings of the cabinet are EAST IR016. I'm not sure if this is a cabinet monitoring flooding in the subway or a cable/BT cabinet.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Elmbridge, Gloucester
